paper_abstract: We analyze the potential of unsupervised neural networks when they are employed to support intraday trading activity on financial markets. Several time frequencies have been considered: from five minutes to daily trades. At the current stage our major findings may be summarized as follows: a) unsupervised neural networks are helpful to localize profitable intraday patterns, and they make possible to achieve higher performances than common trading rules; b) trading strategies based on neural networks make exploitable with profits almost continuous trades (i.e. scalping), until transaction costs maintain below proper thresholds.
paper_title: On the profitability of scalping strategies based on neural networks
